data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3468880,"name":"Ethan Deveney","username":"EthanDeveney","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ethandeveney/{size}/215153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T18:38:42.310Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello community. I have created a public CAD on Onshape that you will all have access to and can make a copy to edit. The idea of this is that each person who wants to participate will make one change to the CAD (with that either being making something in a part studio, making a new assembly, modifying a part studio, or modifying an assembly). When i say one change I don’t mean only changing one single dimension in a sketch, i mean only changing one part or an assembly. If you want to participate, make a comment saying that you will take the next iteration and then make a copy of the last person who posted the link and make your change. When you are done, make an edit to your comment to include the new link (link sharing and export) and then post it. I am doing this to see what the community makes and to encourage cooperation and to broaden horizons and look at things from a new perspective. One final thing before you get the link, using MKCAD is okay and so is using CAD imports for stuff that isnt on MKCAD from places like REV but do not use your own previous CAD or assemblies from other documents to try and add full pieces to get ahead or do more as that would go a bit against the idea of this. If you have any questions ask them and I will do my best to respond. Here’s your \u003ca href=\"https://cad.onshape.com/documents/156774ed470ef17d830d5b11/w/3fa9f217b821bd7de825d320/e/e5b2fa0297172664233857b0?renderMode=0\u0026amp;uiState=67797f33ef2a771534b52d90\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003elink\u003c/a\u003e for whoever wants to make the first change. Have fun and i hope this helps you think in new ways and possibly give you inspiration for what your own team might do.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-04T18:40:21.290Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":208,"reads":198,"readers_count":197,"score":1094.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":478385,"topic_slug":"community-reefscape-robot","display_username":"Ethan Deveney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://cad.onshape.com/documents/156774ed470ef17d830d5b11/w/3fa9f217b821bd7de825d320/e/e5b2fa0297172664233857b0?renderMode=0\u0026uiState=67797f33ef2a771534b52d90","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Onshape","clicks":113}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/community-reefscape-robot/478385/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3468924,"name":"","username":"Tedzzy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb8c5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T18:52:45.742Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHi, I am just curious about the dimensions of the base.
